entryFree.term: a double-sloped roof without a ridge spine (lit.)

note.p: The term juanpeng 卷棚, literally "curved shelter," first appeared in the Ming dynasty and generally refers to a building with a curved roof, as mentioned in Wen Zhengheng’s Treatise on Superfluous Things (Zhangwuzhi 長物志, 1620-1627)（Wen 2021, 13; Lan 1976, 319, 330). This definition extended into the Qing dynasty, when it was often associated with temporary structures, such as those used for funerals or for providing sun protection in agricultural fields. A common characteristic of these structures was the use of bendable materials like fabric, bamboo, or grass to create a curved roof shape.

The character 卷 can also be written as 捲. In Ming and Qing literature, the compound word juanpeng 卷棚 is interchangeable with juanpeng 卷篷/蓬 (curved awning) （e.g. Huang 1551, 26.50b.）The term “curved awning” can be traced back to the Song dynasty, where it often referred to curved stone bridges or boat awnings (e.g. Fan 1503, 13.8b). The image of curved roof buildings called chuanting 船亭 (boat pavilions) also appeared in Song dynasty sources. Therefore, it can be surmised that in the Ming dynasty the use of both ways of writing juanpeng (卷蓬/篷 and 卷棚) to refer to structures with curved roofs was probably an extension of the Song dynasty term 卷篷/蓬.

In modern research, juanpeng is used to describe an interior decoration using paper to form an awning to cover the ceiling from the front eaves to the rear eaves, as one type of biaozuo 裱作 (paper works) in the Forbidden City (Yang 2010, 88-97) In the Jiangnan area, juanpeng is also used to describe a ceiling type constructed with flexible materials so that a “curved-awning” is formed. This is also called fanxuan 翻軒 (lit. upturned and raised (awning) Chen 1988, 79-80).

“卷棚”一詞最早出現于明代文獻，泛指弧形頂的構築物（（兰 1976, 319、330）（文 2021, 13）如《長物志》，或《金瓶梅》）。清代亦沿用了此種語義，並更加顯現出臨時性構築物的特徵， 如“卷棚”可在喪葬儀式中臨時搭建，或在農業生產中臨時搭建用於遮陽等，其共同点是使用可弯曲的材料（如布、竹、草等）形成弧形屋面。“卷棚”在清官式營造文獻中明確指一種瓦屋頂形式（如清工部 1734，卷8，卷12，卷27）， 其特徵為屋頂以頂椽卷過脊檁，不作正脊，瓦壟直接卷過屋面，兩側垂脊也隨瓦壟卷過屋面。
“卷”可寫作“捲” 。明清文獻中卷棚有時又寫作“卷篷/蓬”（如黄，1551，26.50b） ，含义相同，但“卷篷/蓬”一词可追溯至宋代，通常用於形容具有弧形特徵的石橋與船篷（如范，1503，13.8b）， 宋代圖像中也有被稱為船亭的弧形頂建築形象(如《清明上河圖》)。由此推測，明代用“卷蓬/篷”、“卷棚”指代具有弧形頂的構築物很可能是由宋代“卷篷/蓬”延伸而來。
在現代學者的研究中“卷棚”也被用來描述一種用紙張從前簷至後簷覆蓋天花板的室內裝飾，屬於“裱作”工藝的一種（楊，2010，88-97）。在江南地區，“卷棚”也指用柔性材料構建、形成“弧形天篷”的 天花類型，這種結構亦被稱爲“翻軒”（陳，1988：79-80）。
